description: Authorized file list for RULE 2 enforcement - prevents creating new code instead of updating existing

approval_process.description: Before creating any file NOT in authorized_files or always_allowed_patterns
steps: 1. Check: Does file exist in authorized_files? If yes, UPDATE it
2. Check: Does file match always_allowed_patterns? If yes, CREATE it
3. Check: Does file have always_allowed_extension? If yes, CREATE it
4. Otherwise: ASK user before creating (use AskUserQuestion tool)
5. If approved: Add to authorized_files and update manifest

usage_instructions.for_claude: BEFORE using Write tool to create a new file, CHECK this manifest. If file not authorized, you MUST ask user first.
usage_instructions.for_validation_script: After Write operations, check if new file is in manifest. If not authorized â†’ VIOLATION.
usage_instructions.for_users: Add your project files to authorized_files array. Use patterns for test files.

notes: This addresses the user's critical complaint: 'persistent issue has been creating new code instead of updating the specified existing code'
RULE 2 enforcement: This manifest is the technical mechanism that prevents unauthorized file creation
For documentation-only projects: Most files will match always_allowed_patterns
For code projects: Explicitly list all source files in authorized_files
When starting new module: Update manifest FIRST, then create files
